message: Very cool. I think it does.
Thanks for the feedback! I wish i had a better production studio, however I only have a laptop microphone. I will try to see if i can get something better.
works great, you might want to re-record the audio though, it's a little flakey (muffled at points not cleanly recorded etc), other than that great video.

yeh it's a bit obvious, what about recording it as a file on your mobile phone or a headset for your laptop?
The video is fine, you just need to load a different audio track over the video and you're all set.
I will try to see what i can do. If i have to i will go get a mic from best buy or something.
You can buy a cheap semi-pro diaphragm USB mic for < $100… :) I personally like Avid's (ex-M-Audio).
I will probably re-record the audio this weekend with a better mic and repost monday. I guess there is only so much you can do for free
I like it. I actually posted it to may FB wall a few days ago. Yes audio could be better and the lighting is so so but concept is great.
Looks nice, agreed the audio could use a re-recording, maybe even just with a simple usb headset.
Take a look at the Blue Yeti. You can get it around $100 on Amazon. Its heavy, but its quality. I use it from Skype, Podcasting and voiceovers.  My kids use it with Garage band to make silly songs

Videos definitely increase your signups percentage.  We use video to help sellers promote their products at http://www.123exchanges.com  It would look better if you use animation.  YouTube has free tools you can create animation video http://www.youtube.com/create.
videos with carton set you apart and also bring attention ,,something funny also helps a lot
I got the Samson - Studio USB Condenser Mic which is pretty good. Comes with Cakewalk software. I use noise reduction plugin from cockos for voice overs.
